2. Next, I will compare the information in the 'nba draft' column for each player with their respective draft position (indicated by the year and round). If a player was selected in the first round, it means they were picked before the 30th overall pick (since there are 30 teams in the NBA at that time).

3. I will then check if any of the players were drafted in the second round or later. Since those draft positions are not provided in the table, I'll consider those players as exceptions to the claim.

4. Lastly, if all the players except one were selected in their first round draft in their respective year, the claim would be true. If more than one player was not selected in the first round, then the claim is false.

- To find the draft information, we look at the cells where the column name is "nba draft".

- Billy Owens has a height of 6 - 9 and was also selected in the 1st round (3rd pick).

- Chris Mills is taller than Billy Owens since their heights are recorded as "6 - 7" and "6 - 9", respectively.
- Billy Owens is the shortest player in this table because all other players listed have a height greater than or equal to 6 - 9.
- Chris Mills and Billy Owens were both selected for the NBA as indicated by their draft information.
